summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a female witness (name redacted) conducted in Sydney, Australia on March 17, 2011. The witness details her background, her recruitment by Jeffrey Epstein at age 16, her subsequent travel and work for him involving massages and sexual activity, and her interactions with other individuals and clients. The document also notes her identification of individuals from photographs and the collection of evidence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Recruited the witness at age 16, employed her to give massages which escalated to sexual activity, arranged her travel and introduced her to clients.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Introduced as Epstein's assistant early in the witness's relationship with him; involved in travel and activities.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: The witness worked at his Mar-A-Lago Club in Palm Beach, Florida, prior to meeting Epstein.

persons.name: Virginia L. Giuffre
persons.context: Mentioned by the witness as someone she met who was approximately the same age and also involved with Epstein.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The witness was instructed to go shopping for a dress because she would be dancing with him at a club called 'Tramp'.

connections.description: Maxwell was introduced as Epstein's assistant and was involved in the operations surrounding the witness.
The witness was prepared to go out dancing with Prince Andrew at Epstein's instruction.
The witness met Giuffre in the context of their mutual involvement with Epstein.
Epstein recruited, employed, and directed the witness, engaging in a sexual relationship with her.
Maxwell was involved in the witness's activities and travel as part of Epstein's operations.

events.title: Witness begins work at Mar-A-Lago
events.description: The witness began working at Donald Trump's Mar-A-Lago Club in Palm Beach, Florida.

events.title: Recruitment by Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The witness, at age 16, was approached and recruited by Jeffrey Epstein to become a masseuse, leading to her first massage and sexual encounter with him.

events.title: International travel for Epstein
events.description: The witness began traveling extensively for Epstein, including trips to Paris, London, Africa, Spain, and the Caribbean, often on his private plane.

events.title: Witness travels to Thailand for massage training
events.description: The witness traveled to Bangkok, Thailand, to receive formal massage training and certification, during which time she met her future husband.

events.title: FBI interview in Sydney
events.description: The witness was interviewed by FBI Special Agents and an Assistant U.S. Attorney in Sydney, Australia, providing detailed information about her experiences with Epstein.

events.title: Evidence collection from witness
events.description: FBI agents collected 20 photographs and the witness's massage school certification from her residence in Sydney.

locations: Little St. James Island (U.S. Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The witness was recruited by Jeffrey Epstein at age 16 after he approached her while she was reading a massage book at Mar-A-Lago.
The witness described a pattern where massages for Epstein routinely escalated to sexual activity, and she was paid $200 per day for travel and $200 per hour for massages.
The witness was introduced to other clients by Epstein, including an 'older American male' academic and a couple, for whom she provided massages, sometimes erotic, for cash.
The witness stated that Ghislaine Maxwell was introduced as Epstein's assistant early in her relationship with him.
The witness was prepared to go out dancing with Prince Andrew at a club called 'Tramp' on Epstein's instruction.
